dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I feel like it is hard to breathe and I lost my consciousness right before calling the ambulance.

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: I have been breathing harder for 5 days and I lost consciousness 2 hours ago.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I breathe hard as I make an effort, I lost consciousness while sitting at the table; I didn't feel anything, I woke up with my head on the table and my husband shouting at me.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: Initially I was tired after any mild effort, but in the last 2 days I felt tired when I got out of bed.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?

dialog.label: diseases_personal
questions: What illness do you suffer from?
What diseasses do you suffer from?
answers: Colon cancer 3 years ago, operated and underwent chemotherapy and I have also been diagnosed recently with cancer recurrence.

answers: Today was the first time I lost my consciousness.

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I'm suffocating, I'm out of breath.

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: My symptoms starded 2 days ago and got worse by the minute.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I have been feeling very tired in the last two days and I also feel like I'm suffocating even without doing anything, I couldn't even call the ambulance alone - I run out of breath even if I talk.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: It seems to me that I have been suffocating worse and worse since 2 days ago.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?

answers: Hodgkin's lymphoma 2 years ago, chemo-treated, in remission at last assessment (6 months ago) Obesity (BMI = 42 kg / m2)

annotations: Patient institutionalized in a nursing home, found by the ambulance crew with peripheral oxygen saturation of 50% and intubated at the spot.From the anamnesis of the asylum care staff:

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I noticed that he was breathing hard and had low blood pressure, 70/40 mm Hg

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: 3 days ago he started breathing harder and harder.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: He stays in bed because he can't move anymore. For 3 days I noticed that he was breathing harder; he did not complain about anything, but he expressed difficulty because he had a stroke 2 years ago

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: Initially he had a good blood pressure, but this morning I kept taking his blood pressure and I always found it very low, plus he didn't answer when I shouted at him, he opened his eyes but didn’t answer so I called an ambulance.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness your parents suffered from?

dialog.label: diseases_personal
answers: Ischemic stroke 2 years ago and he has arterial hypertension.

dialog.label: chronic_treatment
answers: Aspenter 75 mg / day, Amlodipine 10 mg / day

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: The patient suffered a cardiorespiratory arrest. He is brought to the hospital by the ambulance crew, being intubated and mechanically ventilated.

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: He had no complain before the cardiac arrest happened (information from the witnesses).

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: The cardiopulmonary arrest occurred at Otopeni Airport, shortly after landing from a vacation in New Zealand, after a 14 hour flight.

questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I can't breathe and I feel pressure in my chest.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I noticed when I went to the gym that I could not make the same effort, I breathe harder, I get tired much faster. I feel a pain in the center of my chest when I try to breathe deeply, the air does not enter as it should.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes

answers: Yes, I feel like I've been breathing harder and harder for a week.

questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: 4 days ago I started feeling palpitations but today I fainted while doing mild effort.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: For 4 days I feel my heart beating very fast and regularly, especially if I make some effort, and today while trying to carry some crates I fainted

dialog.label: symptoms_changes

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?
answers: My mother has diabetes and my father died of a stroke at 67 years old.

dialog.label: diseases_personal
answers: Left leg thrombophlebitis 5 years ago. Left leg post-thrombotic syndrome. Chronic venous insufficiency of the lower limbs.

dialog.label: chronic_treatment
answers: Detralex, Aspenter; I received treatment with Thrombostop 6 months after thrombophlebitis, I haven't taken it for over 4 years.

dialog.label: fever_symptoms
questions: Have you had a fever or chills in your recent history?

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: My left leg hurts and I have palpitations.

dialog.label: symptoms_start
answers: My leg has been hurting for a week, I have been feeling palpitations for 2 days.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I thought my leg hurt because I was standing for a long time, in the same position, it had been slightly swollen 2 days ago, but then it deflated. But for 2 days I started to feel my heart beating very fast, out of the blue, and when I measured my pulse I found between 110 and 120 beats per minute.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: My leg hurt more when it was swollen, then the pain subsided. I feel the palpitations especially if I go or do some housework.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?
answers: Mother - hypertension, stroke and death at age 65; Father - liver cirrhosis, death at 68 years.

dialog.label: diseases_personal
questions: What diseases do you know to have?

dialog.label: chronic_treatment
answers: I was prescribed hypertension treatment but I didn't take it.

answers: Appendectomy at age 15. Hydrostatic varicose veins 5 years ago.

dialog.label: visit_reason

answers: I have a back pain and I'm coughing and the pain gets worse when I cough.

answers: Suddenly this stab appeared, but I noticed that it hurts more when I take a deep breath. The cough is dry, I cough both day and night.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes

answers: I took pain medication and the pain eased a little.

dialog.label: diseases_parents

answers: I don't know, they died of old age.

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I noticed that my pulse was increasing.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I regularly monitor my blood pressure and pulse, and I usually had a pulse of 70-80 beats per minute. 4 days ago I returned from Canada and 3 days ago I noticed that my pulse reaches 100 beats per minute.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: It seems to me that since I came back from vacation I get tired more easily, but I think it's because of the time zone difference.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?
answers: Mother - stroke and death at age 45.

dialog.label: fever_symptoms

dialog.label: visit_reason
questions: What is the reason for the presentation at the hospital?
answers: I feel a pain like a stab under my left shoulder blade.

dialog.label: symptoms_circumstances
questions: What are the circumstances of the onset of symptoms?
answers: I had biliary colic 10 days ago and for 3 days I stayed in bed longer, treating myself with antispasmodics. After I got out of bed I noticed this stab-like pain, I had never felt it before.

dialog.label: symptoms_changes
questions: Were there any changes in symptoms from onset to presentation?
answers: A dry cough has also appeared for 2 days. The pain now holds me longer when I take a deep breath.

dialog.label: diseases_parents
questions: Do you know of any illness that your mother or father suffers from?

dialog.label: diseases_personal
answers: Left leg thrombophlebitis 2 years ago. Gallstones - I was repeatedly recommended for surgery, but I refused.

dialog.label: chronic_treatment
answers: Aspirin; I was treated with acenocumarol (blood thinner) for 3 months after thrombophlebitis, but the INR never came out well and I stopped it.
